intro: Geanthus dekockii, commonly known as the Dekock's geanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
